title: Ticket #3749: Use filesystem namespaces to present non-changing execute directory
description:
When USE_FS_NAMESPACES=TRUE, we should use filesystem namespaces to lie about the current working directory, presenting a constant, unchanging answer. Perhaps /work, or perhaps the $(Iwd) (the CWD when the job was submitted)?

Rationale: some self-checkpointing software is ill behaved and encodes absolute paths in their checkpoints. When they move, they get cranky. Implementing this allows such software to Just Work.

$(Iwd) seems optimal becaue the job's environment looks more like the submit point. If the job has hard coded paths to things in $(Iwd), it is more likely to Just Work.

Concrete example: #3747: DMTCP checkpoints can't handle being moved
